Resource Manager for device access
[Resource Manager]

Manages the exclusive usage of devices (GDI, UART, ...), used for foreground and background processes. More...


Data Structures

struct  virtual_dev_struct
 virtual device structure, which keeps track of the requested physical device. RXBuffer and TXbuffer are kept seperately for each virtual device More...

 planned to implement a waiting queue for ressources More...
struct  access_entry
 planned to implement access entries to handle accesses from processes to devices More...

void rm_initGraph (void)
 planned mapping from virtual UIDs to real UIDs
void check_ressource (PCtrlBlock_t *new_running_process)
 checks if new_running_process is a foreground process and has therefor the focus of the screen and other shared devices. has to be executed after each scheduling step.
void set_foreground_process (PCtrlBlock_t *fg_process)
 sets the current foreground process, which gains the focus of LCD and shared devices
void rm_switch_focus (void)
 switches the focus to the next process in the process queue. gets the current runnable processes from the scheduler

 writes a unit of data to the device

 initializes the ressouce manager; initializes the used hash maps, initializes the null device
device_t * ressource_open (DEV_UID *virt_dev_uid, int32_t device_type, int32_t device_number)
 opens the requested ressource and initializes a virtual_dev_t for the request. if a ressource is not yet used, the returned virtual device uid enables to write to the real device. if the ressource is currently used, the virtual_dev_t points to the null device

 closes a device

Detailed Description

Manages the exclusive usage of devices (GDI, UART, ...), used for foreground and background processes.

...
Author:
karl, giaco, momo

0.0.1

Function Documentation

void check_ressource ( PCtrlBlock_t *  new_running_process  ) 

checks if new_running_process is a foreground process and has therefor the focus of the screen and other shared devices. has to be executed after each scheduling step.

Parameters:
new_running_process process to assign ressources to

int8_t init_resource_manager (  ) 

initializes the ressouce manager; initializes the used hash maps, initializes the null device

Parameters:
dev_uid unique device number
dev device independent structure
pointer to data

int8_t release_device ( device_t *  device  ) 

writes a unit of data to the device

Parameters:
dev_uid unique device number
dev device independent structure
pointer to data

int32_t ressource_close ( device_t *  dev,
DEV_UID  dev_uid 
)

closes a device

Parameters:
dev pointer to the device struct
dev_uid virtual device UID

device_t* ressource_open ( DEV_UID *  virt_dev_uid,
int32_t  device_type,
int32_t  device_number 
)

opens the requested ressource and initializes a virtual_dev_t for the request. if a ressource is not yet used, the returned virtual device uid enables to write to the real device. if the ressource is currently used, the virtual_dev_t points to the null device

Parameters:
virt_dev_uid return value, the virtual device uid
device_type the requested device, e.g. AP7000_UART_DEVICE
device_number eg. 1 for COM1

int32_t ressource_read ( DEV_UID  dev_uid,
device_t *  dev,
void *  data 
)

reads data from a device using the virutal_device_uid

Parameters:
dev_uid virtual device uid
dev pointer to device struct
data pointer to data buffer

void ressource_write ( DEV_UID  dev_uid,
device_t *  dev,
void *  data 
)

writes a unit of data to the device using the virtual device uid

Parameters:
dev_uid virtual device uid
dev device independent structure
pointer to data

void rm_initGraph ( void   ) 

planned mapping from virtual UIDs to real UIDs

initializes a graphics context for the process which is currently running

void set_foreground_process ( PCtrlBlock_t *  fg_process  ) 

sets the current foreground process, which gains the focus of LCD and shared devices
